WorkItem.ClosedComment: I see the same thing as Paul. Everything is working correctly in our latest bits.
WorkItem.Description:
If I call a function like this:

```
callSomeFunction(
    arg1,
    arg2
);
```

The Intellisense shows me 'arg1' bolded as the second parameter and not the first.  It shows the first one bolded when I'm on the initial function line, but I didn't put an argument there, so it should not skip ahead.
WorkItem.Summary: Intellisense Skips Argument if not Specified on First Line

Comments.Message:
I don't repro this using the latest code from the develop branch in Visual Studio.

Which version are you using? Are you seeing this in Visual Studio? What does the function definition look like?

Please re-open using the button on top, when you have more info.
